description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to assist the Borrower's Municipality of Wuhan to enhance mobility for passenger trips within and to the central area of Wuhan in an environmentally sustainable, integrated and safe manner.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement, Section 2, B 2 | Description :Prepare and furnish to the Bank interim un-audited financialreports covering the six (6) months period of each Project Report. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement; Section 2, B 3 | Description :Annual audited Financial Statements shall be furnished to the Banknot later than six (6) months after the end of such period. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 1 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall maintain throughout theperiod of implementation of the Project the Project Leading Group. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 2 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall maintain throughout theperiod of implementation of the Project, the WPMO in a manner and substance satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 3 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall maintain WUCFMO with termsof reference, facilities and resources satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 4 b/ | Description :Prepare and furnish to the Bank by February 15 in eachcalendar year, beginning on February 15, 2011, for review and approval, a proposed annual work plan for the carrying out theProject. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 6 a/ | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall: carry out the Projectin accordance with designs, alignment, technical specifications and standards satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 6 b/ | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall maintain and operatesaid roads and public transport facilities in a technically, financiallyand administratively viable manner. | Due Date :31-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 1 - 8 | Description :The Project Implementation Entity shall ensure that the Projectis carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Anti-Corruption Guidelines. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 2 - A 1 | Description :Monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project and preparereports. Reports shall be furnished to the Bank not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of the reporting period. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 2 - A 2 | Description :Provide to the Borrower not later than three (3) months afterthe Closing Date all such information as the Borrower or the Bank shall reasonably request for the purposes of that Section. | DueDate :30-Nov-2017

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 2 - A 3 a/ | Description :Project Implementing Entity shall: (a) by February 15 andAugust 15 of each year furnish to the Bank semi-annual progress reports on implementation of the EMP, the RAP. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 2 - A 3 b/ | Description :by February 15 and August 15 of each year furnish to theBank semi-annual progress report on project implementation. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 2 - A 3 c/ | Description :by December 31, 2012, furnish to the Bank a Projectmid-term review report. | Due Date :31-Oct-2013

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement, Section 2 - A 3 d | Description :based on the recommendations of said reports and the Bankreview and comments thereon, take actions, satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: 2. Number of public transport terminals, interchanges and transfer facility completed
6.3 Shuidong Section of the 2 Ring Road (sub-indicator)
7. % of systems installed for traffic management on four Yangtze River bridges and three Hanjiang River bridges
6. Length of roads improved/constructed of three key links (Shuidong Road, Jiefang Avenue Extension, and Shuidong Section of the 2nd Ring Road) completed
5. Length of road with improved or new constructed physical separation between motorized and non-motorized vehicle flow on RS corridors
10. Number of staff trained on selected topics (in line with capacity building program) with positive assessment of training (Person*day)
4. Number of unsignalized zebras on RS corridors converted to non-conflicting crossings (including signalized mid-block crossings, footbridges and underpasses)
6.2. Jiefang Avenue (Huangpu Road – Dijiao Garden Road) (sub-indicator)
3.3 on Jiefang Avenue Extension (Dibian Road to the 3rd Ring Road) (sub-indicator)
3.1 on the Shuidong Section of the 2nd Ring Road (sub-indicator)
3. Average peak hour travel time on Jiefang Avenue (Huangpu Road to Dibian Road), on Jiefang Avenue Extension (Dibian Road to the 3rd Ring Road), and on the Shuidong Section of the 2nd Ring Road.
2. Average number of fatalities per year on four Road Safety corridors
1. Modal share of public transport (bus and metro) on targeted PT corridors
4. Average peak hour travel time by bus along targeted PT corridors
3.2 on Jiefang Avenue (Huangpu Road to Dibian Road) (sub-indicator)
1. % of bus stops targeted on PT corridors with enhanced accessibility for vulnerable users
3. Number of intersections with traffic signals with pedestrian phase on RS corridors
8. Definition and adoption of a bus route optimization strategy

target.value: Definition and adoption of a bus route optimization strategy

title.narrative: 9. Definition and adoption of systematic parking pricing policy and a hierarchical parking zonal system

baseline.value: No systematic parking pricing policy and a hierarchical parking zonal system

target.value: Definition and adoption of systematic parking pricing policy and a hierarchical parking zonal system

title.narrative: 6. Wuhan City develops a strategy for environmentally friendly construction, maintenance, and operation of urban mobility infrastructure
5. Wuhan city develops and integrated public transport strategy
